documentation.text:
@dev Common interface for {ERC20Votes}, {ERC721Votes}, and other {Votes}-enabled contracts.
 _Available since v4.5._
@dev Emitted when an account changes their delegate.
@dev Emitted when a token transfer or delegate change results in changes to a delegate's number of votes.
@dev Returns the current amount of votes that `account` has.
@dev Returns the amount of votes that `account` had at the end of a past block (`blockNumber`).

@dev Returns the total supply of votes available at the end of a past block (`blockNumber`).
 NOTE: This value is the sum of all available votes, which is not necessarily the sum of all delegated votes.
 Votes that have not been delegated are still part of total supply, even though they would not participate in a
 vote.
@dev Returns the delegate that `account` has chosen.
@dev Delegates votes from the sender to `delegatee`.
@dev Delegates votes from signer to `delegatee`.
@dev Interface of the ERC20 standard as defined in the EIP.

@dev Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by
 a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.
@dev Returns the amount of tokens in existence.
@dev Returns the amount of tokens owned by `account`.

@dev Returns the remaining number of tokens that `spender` will be
 allowed to spend on behalf of `owner` through {transferFrom}. This is
 zero by default.
 This value changes when {approve} or {transferFrom} are called.

@dev Sets `amount` as the allowance of `spender` over the caller's tokens.
 Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
 IMPORTANT: Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk
 that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate
 transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race
 condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the
 desired value afterwards:
 https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729
 Emits an {Approval} event.

@dev Moves `amount` tokens from `from` to `to` using the
 allowance mechanism. `amount` is then deducted from the caller's
 allowance.
 Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded.
 Emits a {Transfer} event.

@dev Interface of the ERC165 standard, as defined in the
 https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165[EIP].
 Implementers can declare support of contract interfaces, which can then be
 queried by others ({ERC165Checker}).
 For an implementation, see {ERC165}.

@dev Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by
 `interfaceId`. See the corresponding
 https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[EIP section]
 to learn more about how these ids are created.
 This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: This implementation does not decrease spender allowance if the maximum allowance was granted.The underflow condition is treated by the default code generation check.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).notice: The overflow condition is treated by the default code generation check.

inflationControl(uint256).notice: The `<=` check is left as is for a better code readability.

mint(address,uint256).notice: If the inflation control does not pass, the revert does not take place, as well as no action is performed.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Decreases the allowance of another account over their tokens.

params.spender: Account that tokens are approved for.

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Increases the allowance of another account over their tokens.

params.spender: Account that tokens are approved for.

inflationControl(uint256).details: Provides various checks for the inflation control.

inflationRemainder().details: Gets the reminder of OLAS possible for the mint.

devdoc.author: ALAleksandr Kuperman - <aleksandr.kuperman@valory.xyz>
devdoc.title: OLAS - Smart contract for the OLAS token.

getLastUserPoint(address).details: Gets the most recently recorded user point for `account`.

getNominee(uint256).notice: The zero-th default nominee Id with id == 0 does not count.

getNominees(uint256,uint256).notice: The zero-th default nominee Id with id == 0 does not count.

getNumNominees().notice: The zero-th default nominee Id with id == 0 does not count.

nomineeRelativeWeightWrite(address,uint2.notice: Any address can call, however nothing is recorded if the values are filled already.

addNominee(address,uint256).details: Add nominee address along with the chain Id.

checkpoint().details: Checkpoint to fill data common for all nominees.

checkpointNominee(address,uint256).details: Checkpoint to fill data for both a specific nominee and common for all nominees.

getNominee(uint256).details: Get the nominee address and its corresponding chain Id.

params.id: Nominee Id in the global set of (nominee | chainId) values.

getNomineeId(address,uint256).details: Gets the nominee Id in the global nominees set.

getNominees(uint256,uint256).details: Get the set of nominee addresses and corresponding chain Ids.

params.startId: Start Id of the nominee in the global set of (nominee | chainId) values.

nomineeRelativeWeight(address,uint256,ui.details: Get Nominee relative weight (not more than 1.0) normalized to 1e18 and the sum of weights.         (e.g. 1.0 == 1e18). Inflation which will be received by it is         inflation_rate * relativeWeight / 1e18.

params.time: Relative weight at the specified timestamp in the past or present.

nomineeRelativeWeightWrite(address,uint2.details: Get nominee weight normalized to 1e18 and also fill all the unfilled values for type and nominee records.      Also, get the total sum of all the nominee weights.

params.time: Relative weight at the specified timestamp in the past or present.

voteForNomineeWeights(address,uint256,ui.details: Allocate voting power for changing pool weights.

params.nominee: Address of the nominee the `msg.sender` votes for.
params.weight: Weight for a nominee in bps (units of 0.01%). Minimal is 0.01%. Ignored if 0.

voteForNomineeWeightsBatch(address[],uin.details: Allocate voting power for changing pool weights in batch.

params.nominees: Set of nominees the `msg.sender` votes for.
params.weights: Weights for a nominees in bps (units of 0.01%). Minimal is 0.01%. Ignored if 0.

getUserPoint(address,uint256).notice: The out of bound condition is treated by the default code generation check.

userdoc.notice: This token supports the ERC20 interface specifications except for transfers and approvals.

allowance(address,address).details: Reverts the allowance of this token.

approve(address,uint256).details: Reverts the approval of this token.

balanceOf(address).details: Gets the account balance in native token.

balanceOfAt(address,uint256).details: Gets the account balance at a specific block number.

createLock(uint256,uint256).details: Deposits `amount` tokens for `msg.sender` and locks for `unlockTime`.

params.unlockTime: Time when tokens unlock, rounded down to a whole week.

createLockFor(address,uint256,uint256).details: Deposits `amount` tokens for `account` and locks for `unlockTime`.

params.unlockTime: Time when tokens unlock, rounded down to a whole week.

depositFor(address,uint256).details: Deposits `amount` tokens for `account` and adds to the lock.Anyone (even a smart contract) can deposit for someone else, but      cannot extend their locktime and deposit for a brand new user.

getLastUserPoint(address).details: Gets the most recently recorded user point for `account`.

getNumUserPoints(address).details: Gets the number of user points.

getPastTotalSupply(uint256).details: Calculate total voting power at some point in the past.

params.blockNumber: Block number to calculate the total voting power at.

getPastVotes(address,uint256).details: Gets voting power at a specific block number.

getUserPoint(address,uint256).details: Gets the checkpoint structure at number `idx` for `account`.

increaseAmount(uint256).details: Deposits `amount` additional tokens for `msg.sender` without modifying the unlock time.

params.amount: Amount of tokens to deposit and add to the lock.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Gets information about the interface support.

totalSupplyAt(uint256).details: Gets total token supply at a specific block number.

totalSupplyLockedAtT(uint256).details: Calculates total voting power at time `ts`.

params.ts: Time to get total voting power at.

transfer(address,uint256).details: Reverts the transfer of this token.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Reverts the transferFrom of this token.

withdraw().details: Withdraws all tokens for `msg.sender`. Only possible if the lock has expired.

userdoc.notice: Modern and gas efficient ERC20 + EIP-2612 implementation.

devdoc.author: Solmate (https://github.com/Rari-Capital/solmate/blob/main/src/tokens/ERC20.sol)Modified from Uniswap (https://github.com/Uniswap/uniswap-v2-core/blob/master/contracts/UniswapV2ERC20.sol)
devdoc.details: Do not manually set balances without updating totalSupply, as the sum of all user balances must not exceed it.

delegate(address).details: Delegates votes from the sender to `delegatee`.

delegates(address).details: Returns the delegate that `account` has chosen.

getPastTotalSupply(uint256).details: Returns the total supply of votes available at the end of a past block (`blockNumber`). NOTE: This value is the sum of all available votes, which is not necessarily the sum of all delegated votes. Votes that have not been delegated are still part of total supply, even though they would not participate in a vote.

getPastVotes(address,uint256).details: Returns the amount of votes that `account` had at the end of a past block (`blockNumber`).

getVotes(address).details: Returns the current amount of votes that `account` has.

devdoc.details: Common interface for {ERC20Votes}, {ERC721Votes}, and other {Votes}-enabled contracts. _Available since v4.5._

allowance(address,address).details: Returns the remaining number of tokens that `spender` will be allowed to spend on behalf of `owner` through {transferFrom}. This is zero by default. This value changes when {approve} or {transferFrom} are called.

approve(address,uint256).details: Sets `amount` as the allowance of `spender` over the caller's tokens. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. IMPORTANT: Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729 Emits an {Approval} event.

balanceOf(address).details: Returns the amount of tokens owned by `account`.

totalSupply().details: Returns the amount of tokens in existence.

transfer(address,uint256).details: Moves `amount` tokens from the caller's account to `to`. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Emits a {Transfer} event.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Moves `amount` tokens from `from` to `to` using the allowance mechanism. `amount` is then deducted from the caller's allowance. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Emits a {Transfer} event.

devdoc.details: Interface of the ERC20 standard as defined in the EIP.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[EIP section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

devdoc.details: Interface of the ERC165 standard, as defined in the https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165[EIP]. Implementers can declare support of contract interfaces, which can then be queried by others ({ERC165Checker}). For an implementation, see {ERC165}.
